Class TicTacToe

java.lang.Object
MyGame.Game.TicTacToe
Direct Known Subclasses:
TicTacToeUI
public class TicTacToe extends Object
A extended Tic Tac Toe game, with a 15x15 board and you connect 5 dots in a row to win.

Work is in progress to allow more than 2 players. Soon, hopefully.

    • CENTER

      static final TicTacToe.Coordinate CENTER
      The center of the board.

      This is used to calculate the distance to the center of the board when choosing a random slot.

  • Constructor Details

    • TicTacToe

      public TicTacToe(String... playerIDs)
      Creates a new Tic Tac Toe game.

      The IDs of the players are required to determine who to play first. Essentially it should be random, but we cannot use Random because the server and clients must agree on who plays first. One thing they do agree is the IDs of all parties, and they are assigned randomly.

      Parameters:
      playerIDs - the IDs of the players

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(Integer move)
      Updates the game state with a new move.
      Parameters:
      move - the move to make, represented as a number in range [0, 225)

      Returns:
      whether it's available to play

    • getNextPlayerID

      public String getNextPlayerID()
      Gets the ID of the player whose turn it is.
      Returns:
      the ID of the next player

    • getWinnerID

      public String getWinnerID()
      Gets the ID of the player who won.

      If the game is not over, this will return null.

      Returns:
      the ID of the winning player, or null if the game is not over

    • getAvailableMove

      public Integer getAvailableMove()
      Gets an empty slot on the board.

      This is to serve as a "good enough" starting point for the player of where to play next. It's not meant to be a good move, just better than a random slot, or say, the upper left corner.

      The slot is the closest available one to the last played move (using a special TicTacToe.Coordinate.distance(MyGame.Game.TicTacToe.Coordinate) metric), with a bias towards the center of the board, plus a bit of randomness.

      Returns:
      the ordinal of an empty slot, null if the game is over

    • getMoveAt

      Integer getMoveAt(TicTacToe.Coordinate coord)
      Get the ordinal of the player who played at a position.

      Since the game has two players, the ordinal is either 0 or 1.

      Parameters:
      coord - the coordinate to check
      Returns:
      the ordinal of the player who played at the position, or null if the position is empty

    • getMoveAt

      Integer getMoveAt(int row, int col)
      Get the ordinal of the player who played at a position.

      Since the game has two players, the ordinal is either 0 or 1.

      Parameters:
      row - the row of the position
      col - the column of the position
      Returns:
      the ordinal of the player who played at the position, or null if the position is empty

    • isWinningSlot

      boolean isWinningSlot(int row, int col)
      Checks if a slot is part of the 5 connected slots that won the game.
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the slot
      col - the column of the slot
      Returns:
      true if the slot is winning, false otherwise

    • getNextPlayer

      Integer getNextPlayer()
      Gets the ordinal of the player to move next.

      Since the game has two players, the ordinal is either 0 or 1.

      Returns:
      the ordinal of the player to move next, or null if the game is over.
